Kathryn Csete

Physical therapy student at Duke University

Currently a third year physical therapy student in the Duke Doctor of Physical Therapy Program. Passionate about educating people about the importance of exercise and taking care of one’s body. Experience in teaching group fitness and eager to enhance my fitness repertoire. Constantly seeking out new learning experiences and keeping up to date with current research in order to provide optimum care to patients.

Education

  • Doctor of Physical Therapy Program
  • Duke University
  • Durham, NC
  • Graduating in May 2016
  • Exercise Physiology, Minor in Nutrition
  • California State University
  • Chico, CA
  • 2009 – 2013

Physical Therapy Experience

  • Student Physical Therapist
  • Professional Rehab Associates, Christiansburg, VA
  • July 2015 – October 2015
  • Practicing physical therapy under the supervision of a licensed physical therapist on a 12 week clinical rotation as a part of the Duke DPT curriculum. The clinic treats patients with injuries across a variety of disciplines including musculoskeletal, neurological, pediatric, geriatric, women’s health, and division 1 athletes.
  • Student Physical Therapist
  • Student Team Experience in Practice (STEPs)
  • 2014 – 2015
  • As a part of the Duke DPT curriculum, participated in practicing physical therapy in a team of 4 students along with a physical therapist clinical instructor. Worked on applying skills learned in the classroom, demonstrating clinical problem-solving, and assuming a professional role in various clinical patient care settings. Spent 4 weeks in acute care at Duke Hospital and 4 weeks in outpatient orthopaedics at North Carolina Orthopaedic Clinic, distributed throughout 2 years.
  • Student Physical Therapist
  • Movement Matters Program
  • 2014 – 2015
  • Performed physical therapy on a single patient for 10 weeks in both an adult and pediatric neurological setting, working in a team of 4 other students and a mentor who is currently a practicing DPT.
  • Job Shadowing
  • Enloe Hospital Inpatient Rehabilitation, Chico, CA
  • 2011 – 2012
  • Shadowed at an in-patient rehabilitation setting and also saw some outpatient physical therapy. There was a variety of diagnoses to observe ranging from neurological, vestibular, and orthopedic.
  • Job Shadowing
  • Scripps Ranch Physical Therapy, San Diego, CA
  • 2011
  • This clinic has 5 physical therapists to shadow including a hand/wrist specialist. Scripps is an outpatient orthopaedic setting with an emphasis on manual therapy. Daily tasks outside of shadowing included cleaning plinth tables, laundry, keeping the clinic organized and monitoring the patients as they went through their exercises with the physical therapy aid.
  • Job Shadowing
  • Ocean Physical Therapy, San Diego, CA
  • 2011
  • Observed the single physical therapist of this outpatient clinic in manual techniques, home exercise instruction, and modality application. The majority of the patient population consisted of neck and spine, but the therapist treated other orthopaedic patients as well.

Work Experience

  • Group Fitness Instructor
  • Duke University Wilson Recreation Center, Durham, NC
  • May 2014 – July 2015
  • Taught the following fitness classes, spinning, high intensity interval training, and muscle pump, to participants at the recreation center. Responsibilities include preparing workouts and playlists ahead of time, motivating participants and education about proper form and overall health.
  • Facility Monitor/Guest Service Attendant
  • Duke University Wilson Recreation Center, Durham, NC
  • May 2014 – July 2015
  • Monitor the facility to keep it clean and organize equipment. Monitor the members to make sure they are staying safe. Assist facility members when they need help. Open and close facility.

Volunteering

  • Duke DPT 5k
  • 2015
  • The Duke DTP 5k is a fundraiser marathon for the class of 2016. I helped set up the event, cheer on participants, and clean up after the race.
  • Valor Games
  • 2014, 2015
  • The Valor Games is a competition for disabled Veterans and disabled members of the Armed forces. I Volunteered to assist participants partake in the sporting events, making sure that everyone stays safe, and providing both emotional and physical support when needed.
  • Dance Dash 5k
  • 2014
  • Dance Dash is a 5k marathon benefiting Children’s Miracle Network Hostpitals. At this event I Volunteered to guide runners in the right direction and provided support throughout the race.

Goals

  • Plan and lead a treatment session with minimal input from my CI
  • Identify a physical therapy diagnosis for patients after I evaluate them
  • Be able to comfortably answer patient questions about their healing process
  • Increase my knowledge on healing timeframes of different tissues following surgical procedures
  • Progress athletes in sport specific exercises and identify readiness to return to sport
  • Be able to utilize my clinical reasoning during a treatment session when original plans change
  • Keep updated on current research findings by seeking out and reading more articles each month and/or listening to podcasts
  • Advocate for physical therapy by educating patients about direct access
